page.title: 06Communication Swine/Coniston
page.content: The main A165 Hull to Bridlington road now by-passes Coniston but until the 1960's it formed the village's main street. To get to Swine however, it is still necessary to pass through Coniston for about a mile westwards along a little used back road. Swine is a dead end village of 18th and 19th century brick houses strung along its single street. It once boasted a railway station serving the two villages and the outlying farms. With the demise of the Hull to Hornsea railway under the Beeching plan the villagers now have to rely on a twice weekly bus service. The rest of this extremely rural area is served only by paths, tracks, and minor roads to the low lying farms scattered about the countryside.
